thread.title: No. 4 Gophers claim Big Ten lead, fight off Badgers
thread.title_full: No. 4 Gophers claim Big Ten lead, fight off Badgers

title: No. 4 Gophers claim Big Ten lead, fight off Badgers
text:
More No. 4 Gophers claim Big Ten lead, fight off Badgers The Gophers are back on top of the Big Ten after defeating Wisconsin, 3-2. (Courtesy Minnesota Gophers via Twitter) Feb 25, 2017 at 10:54p ET 0Shares 
With the game tied 2-2 and the lead in the Big Ten on the line, the No. 4 Minnesota Gophers looked to their captain for an answer. 
He responded. The captain, Justin Kloos, puts @GopherHockey up 3-2 in the 3rd period. Catch the game on #FOXSportsGO https://t.co/A9SPrZk6LK pic.twitter.com/9LiO3fDhyT 
— FOX Sports North (@fsnorth) February 26, 2017 
Captain Justin Kloos scored his 17th goal of the season to put the Gophers up 3-2 with 5:06 to play in the third period, courtesy of assists by Rem Pitlick and Tyler Sheehy. Minnesota went on to win the game 3-2 and was able to hold off a late Badgers rally. 
With 37 seconds remaining, Gophers forward Vinni Lettieri saved a puck that was inches from crossing the goal line to preserve the win. 
Eric Schierhorn and Vinni Lettieri keep @GopherHockey up 3-2 in the final moments. Catch the game on #FOXSportsGO https://t.co/A9SPrZk6LK pic.twitter.com/oZAbJIbu7N 
— FOX Sports North (@fsnorth) February 26, 2017 
The Gophers jumped out to a quick start and led 2-0 after the first period. They also had the advantage in first-period shots, 15-5. 
Rem Pitlick broke open the game with his 11th goal of the season. 
Rem Pitlick scores his 11th of the season to put @GopherHockey up 1-0 in the 1st. Catch the game on #FOXSportsGO https://t.co/A9SPrZk6LK pic.twitter.com/qtBkadxSc2 
— FOX Sports North (@fsnorth) February 26, 2017 
Ryan Norman had an incredible display of hand-eye coordination with just 4.7 seconds remaining in the first period, as he batted a puck out of midair to put the Gophers up, 2-0. 
Power Play goal by Ryan Norman with 5 seconds left in the 1st to put @GopherHockey up 2-0. Watch on #FOXSportsGO https://t.co/A9SPrZk6LK pic.twitter.com/c6cKLcbJJk 
— FOX Sports North (@fsnorth) February 26, 2017 
Wisconsin rallied back in the second period. Luke Kunin and Jake Linhart both found the back of the net to tie the game, but the Gophers prevailed in the third period. 
Kloos tallied two points in the winning effort, tying him for 31st place in Gophers history for points scored. 
Minnesota improves to 21-9-2 overall and 12-4-0-0 in the Big Ten. Wisconsin (18-11-1, 11-5-0-0 Big Ten) falls to second place in the conference. 0
